bioIntro.title: Programming · Food Tech & Innovation
bioIntro.lead: Developing reliable web and mobile apps (Next.js, React Native) with a practical and measurable approach.
bioIntro.bio1: I got to the University of Gastronomic Sciences thanks to a scholarship. There my passion for food was born and, almost as a counterpoint, for technology applied to the sector. I finished with an internship at Argotec and a thesis on astronaut meal production: an experience that taught me method and attention to detail.
bioIntro.bio2: After a period between cheese production and food safety consulting, I realized I was looking for a different way to create value. In 2017 I left my comfort zone and went to Scotland to improve my English and change perspective. There I met people who had trained themselves: a light bulb went on.
bioIntro.bio3: I chose Bangalore (India) for three intensive months: spartan life, many questions, and the first serious steps in web and mobile development. Since then, between online courses, real projects and nights of trying, failing and redoing, I have continued to grow steadily.
bioIntro.bio4: Today I work as a freelancer. My goal is to help people, companies and teams transform ideas into products, with care for performance, accessibility and results. Over time I have enriched my profile with experiences in AI and a solid foundation in blockchain (ConsenSys Academy, 2021), in addition to certifications and recognitions in my first world, that of food.
bioIntro.bio5: For the year ahead, I've decided to make my time accessible to everyone: whether you're curious to get your hands dirty with technology, have an idea to transform into digital reality, or represent a company looking for the right technical partner. I've created a simple system: my time is bookable by quota. Choose the percentage you need, see hours and investment instantly, and let's get started.

items.question: How does the quota booking work?
items.answer: Pick a percentage of my yearly availability. You immediately see estimated hours and investment. We then align on goals, priorities and timeline.

items.question: Do you support early-stage ideas?
items.answer: Yes. With the MVP Sprint we define scope, build a lean prototype and validate on the field with minimal costs.

items.question: Can I learn the basics to build on my own?
items.answer: Absolutely: the track includes modern programming basics (JavaScript/Next.js) and AI tools to go from idea to test quickly.

items.question: Do you work on-site?
items.answer: Yes, on request and for specific windows (workshops, discovery, sprints). Remote support is available continuously.

nft-luxury-wine.longDescription: This innovative marketplace combines the exclusivity of luxury wines with blockchain technology, creating a unique digital ecosystem where wine enthusiasts can own, trade, and eventually redeem physical bottles through NFTs. Built on Ethereum with robust smart contracts, it represents the future of collectible asset trading.
highlights: Ethereum-based smart contracts with OpenZeppelin ERC721
challenges: Bridging digital ownership with physical asset redemption
Creating intuitive UX for blockchain interactions
results: Deployed on Ethereum testnet with full functionality
Integrated IPFS for decentralized metadata storage
